Excellent lather, performance and scent; fussy bottle I'm impressed with this face soap. It's very thick and silky, and only a very small amount is needed to get good results. That's especially welcome to find out given the price for a pretty small bottle. It lathers up well and does a good job of cleaning without leaving my skin overly dry. It is a bit more intensive than other face soaps, so my face does feel a little 'tight' after using it. However, it's not excessive, and well worth it given how well this soap cleans if you have an oily complexation. The charcoal makes the soap dark, but it's not as jet-black as other charcoal soaps I've used. It's more of a deep gray.

The scent is also quite nice. It's a medium/light intensity and has sort of an after-shave smell to it. The scent does not linger much at all after rinsing. While I tend to prefer unscented soaps, this scent is pleasant and enjoyable.

The only con is the bottle. Getting the pump nozzle to pop up was a chore since the retaining ring the pump head screws into also rotates, making it a struggle to get the nozzle to pop up. I eventually got it working, but have noticed that the pump leaks at the stem. It's a small leak, but it adds up over a few days to make a mess on the bottle and waste soap. Given the price, the pump mechanism should have been of better quality.

One star down for the bottle issues, but otherwise, it's a very enjoyable soap to use.

Amazing Product! I waited to write a review on this product because, at first, I was not sure about it. The product is well packaged and easy to use. I am 54 years old and after the first night I used it, I woke up the next morning and my face was red and a bit swollen. At first I thought maybe I was having an allergic reaction. I noticed after one use my skin was much smoother, as if the top layer of dead skin came off. I gave my face a few days of a break, as this product seems to be a strong one, and reluctantly tried it again. I did not have the same reaction with the redness and swelling. So I kept using this product, but as it is a strong one, I use it only 2-3 times a week. After about a couple of weeks using it, I discovered all kinds of undesirable things coming out of the pores of my skin, I developed little pussy sores and pimples, but the pimples were not like the regular pimple, these were deep and what came out was really think and sometimes hard. Instead of having what I thought was an allergic reaction, I think this product was pulling impurities out of my skin and detoxing it. I also had a couple of small, sebaceous cysts on my forehead and after about a month of using this product, they were gone! I was told by a plastic surgeon the only way to get rid of them was surgery but I didn't want the scar on my forehead so never had anything done about them, I had them for years. To this day, the cysts are gone. My skin no longer reacts as if impurities are being pulled out. There is still a small amount of burning on the nights I use this product but if I follow it up with argon oil or rose hip oil, the burning goes away. I've noticed my skin is a firmer, smoother in texture, very soft, and the skin tone is more even. Although I got amazing results, this product may be overpriced considering it is only ascorbic acid. Maybe the products in the activator justifies the price but as I'm not an expert on ingredients, I'm not sure.

I go through lotion and cream fast as I use it every time I wash my hands and more, so I like this bigger size as it lasts longer but is still a compact size for my purse. It‚Äôs also big enough for a long weekend away from home.

This is a lightweight mineral oil based lotion that absorbs quickly and doesn‚Äôt leave any greasy residue. It has a pleasant feel and adds just enough moisture to make my dry hands soft and fairly comfortable. I do prefer more hydration, but I also have dry rather than normal skin. The fragrance is moderately strong and sweet. It‚Äôs okay used just on my hands, but it would be too strong for me if used as an all over body lotion.

I dislike that this lotion has controversial Triethanolamine (TEA). The FDA designates it as safe for limited use (but bans it from hand sanitizer), but EWG rates it as a moderate health risk (allergen). And TEA can play a role in the formation of dangerous nitrosamines when combined with certain preservatives. I can‚Äôt assess that issue in this or any specific products, so I just try to avoid TEA. That aside, I like this lotion pretty well for limited use. 3.5 Stars.

So Good My Girlfriend Stole It From Me - Very Good Facial Cleansing Brush I'm confident more women than men get this brush and it is a little feminine for my style but I wanted to try something to see if I could improve my skin condition. The brush feels very well manufactured and the design is aesthetically pleasing. I got the brush handle and all of the brush wet and had no issues. I didn't learn until later that some brushes recommend you don't get anything other than the brush head wet. I treated this kind of like I treat a razor. I did not submerge it nor would I. The brush definitely loosens up dirt and oil on your face quickly. I felt the LumaRx had a significant power for scrubbing my face.

The brush comes with multiple brush attachments, to be honest I haven't completely figured out which attachment is best for what job so I use the softer brush. I have used this a few times in the morning before shaving and it does a very good job of helping me get a much closer shave, I believe because it deeply moisturizes the whiskers and helps them stand up better for a clean cut.

The brush comes with a travel bag and charger, the heads are very easy to change and are durable. Charging is quick and I've used it more than a dozen times on one charge.

I think I must have talked too much about how much I liked this brush so my girlfriend decided to start using it and I'm afraid I'm not going to see it again!

Comprehensive review of robusta coffee scrub I recently used this scrub and felt inspired to write a review about it for those that aren't sure if they should get this scrub or not.

Before buying this scrub, I was aware coffee scrubs have been trending for a year or so. As others, I was very skeptical about it and wasn't sure how I felt about this beauty trend. The only way I was going to find out was to give it a try.

Here's what I learned after using it that I think will help others should you decide to try it:

1) Prepare your environment and set aside time before using it - Prior to using the scrub, decide where you are going to use it (shower, bath, fenced backyard, etc.) because I'm warning you now, it's gonna get messy. I have a regular sized shower/bath, so if I plan on using this again, I would get myself completely wet, sit in the tub, use the scrub all over my body, rinse off (still sitting), then finally stand up to complete washing off. If you have a private fenced off backyard where you are near a hose, that's a good setting too. The whole process took approximately 40-50 minutes (I like to take my time). I used the whole pack because I literally used it all over my body, but you can use whatever amount you want. Just know that you will need time to really work it into your skin and let it set for a few minutes before washing it off.

2) Be honest with yourself about your skin regimen - What I mean is, if you are not disciplined about your skin regimen or don't want to take time to use this scrub, then honestly I don't know this product is going to work for you. Personally, I'm committed to a regular and consistent skin regimen and set aside time to use this product to get optimal results. I am just saying this isn't like a typical scrub and takes more time to work it in to your skin.

3) You'll likely need soap to get the rest of it off - Even after a rinse, it will stain, just like coffee will do, so I used some shea butter body wash and a body brush to get the rest of it off. Once I was completely clean, I dried off and used body shop cocoa butter all over my body (it's what I usually use anyway).

4) For people with very oily skin be aware - Since this product has coconut oil and you are highly prone to breaking out, I'm not sure if this is a good idea; the amount of coconut oil is definitely noticeable so just be aware.

The verdict: I will say, this made me feel amazing afterwards. My skin felt very smooth and soft. That being said, I bought it without having any expectations. I tried it mainly out of curiosity. As there are advances in beauty products, I am naturally going to want to try new things. I have heard that coffee scrubs reduce cellulite or supports regeneration of new skin cells. Honestly I don't know if that's true and frankly find that doubtful. However, I can say it is better than most scrubs I've used in the past, and it's a wonderful treat for the skin from time to time. I would buy and use it again for occasional use.

The flower (called a "fascinator" in the bridal industry, I'm learning) is very nice, and I will definitely wear it. I may cut the wires with the bling off, but that's just me. I'm having a simple summer picnic wedding with a white, cotton halter dress, and the bling might be a bit too much. I am going to ask my best friend before making this decision. The birdcage veil, though, wasn't really how it's pictured. In the photo it seems to have a lot more conformity to a human head than the actual piece that showed up in my mailbox. The real thing starts out unruly, and popped up in weird places on my head. I tried calming the thing down with bobby pins, but it still looked unshapely. Finally, though, after watching the company's videos (they give you a piece of paper with a link to some instructional videos) and keeping it near the shower for a few days to get it to calm down, it did actually look good. I have a large head with puffy hair, and I found that if I put the comb towards the back of my head on the right, and allow the veil to come up over top my head from the back right, hanging down around my face, that the veil's large size is actually an asset, because it covers my puffy hair without flattening it.

I was so worried about the veil that I ordered a separate, handmade birdcage veil from etsy for $30 (see it at pompandplumage.com) that I hoped would be more what I'm looking for. When it arrived, though, it was too small to wear without wearing my puffy hairstyle slicked back, which isn't how I plan to wear my hair.
